H0.text: In which town in Flanders could you visit the World War I memorial called the Menin Gate. Bruges

H1.text: In which town in Flanders could you visit the World War I memorial called the Menin Gate. Antwerp

H2.text: In which town in Flanders could you visit the World War I memorial called the Menin Gate. Ghent

H3.text: In which town in Flanders could you visit the World War I memorial called the Menin Gate. Iper

A4.text: The Menin Gate (Dutch: Menenpoort), officially the Menin Gate Memorial to the Missing, is a war memorial in Ypres, Belgium

A6.text: Ypres is a city in the province of West Flanders.

A7.text: Information about World War I excavations near Ypres

A8.text: Pilgrimage to Ypres and Sanctuary Wood

A9.text: The Menin Gate memorial became a focal point for British pilgrims to the Western front after it was opened in 1927.

A10.text: The Battle of Ypres was a series of engagements during the First World War, near the Belgian city of Ypres

A11.text: First Battle of Ypres (19 October – 22 November 1914)

A12.text: The Ypres Salient, around Ypres, in Belgium, was the scene of several battles and a major part of the Western Front during World War I.

A13.text: Ypres lies at the junction of the Ypres–Comines Canal and the Ieperlee.
